refsynopsisdiv.title: Synopsis

refsect1.title: Properties
refsect1.synopsis: filename gchararray : Read / Write / Construct Only limit gint : Read / Write size gint : Read

refsect2.title: GtkRecentManager
refsect2.para: Acts as a database of information about the list of recently used files. Normally, you retrieve the recent manager for a particular screen using gtk_recent_manager_get_for_screen() and it will contain information about current recent manager for that screen.

refsect2.title: GtkRecentInfo
refsect2.para: Contains informations found when looking up an entry of the recently used files list.

refsect2.title: GtkRecentData
refsect2.para: Meta-data to be passed to gtk_recent_manager_add_full() when registering a recently used resource.

Meta-data passed to gtk_recent_manager_add_full(). You should use GtkRecentData if you want to control the meta-data associated to an entry of the recently used files list when you are adding a new file to it.

listitem.simpara: a UTF-8 encoded string, containing the name of the recently used resource to be displayed, or NULL;
a UTF-8 encoded string, containing a short description of the resource, or NULL;
the MIME type of the resource;
the name of the application that is registering this recently used resource;
a vector of strings containing groups names;
whether this resource should be displayed only by the applications that have registered it or not.

refsect2.title: GTK_RECENT_MANAGER_ERROR
refsect2.para: The GQuark used for GtkRecentManagerError errors.

refsect2.title: enum GtkRecentManagerError
refsect2.para: Error codes for GtkRecentManager operations

listitem.simpara: the URI specified does not exists in the recently used resources list.
the URI specified is not valid.
the supplied string is not UTF-8 encoded.
no application has registered the specified item.
failure while reading the recently used resources file.
failure while writing the recently used resources file.
unspecified error.

refsect2.title: gtk_recent_manager_new ()
refsect2.para: Creates a new recent manager object. Recent manager objects are used to handle the list of recently used resources. A GtkRecentManager object monitors the recently used resources list, and emits the "changed" signal each time something inside the list changes.
GtkRecentManager objects are expensive: be sure to create them only when needed. You should use the gtk_recent_manager_new_for_screen() or the gtk_recent_manager_get_default() functions instead.

listitem.simpara: A newly created GtkRecentManager object.

refsect2.para: Since 2.10

refsect2.title: gtk_recent_manager_get_default ()
refsect2.para: Gets the recent manager for the default screen. See gtk_recent_manager_get_for_screen().

listitem.simpara: A unique GtkRecentManager associated with the default screen. This recent manager is associated with the screen and can be used as long as the screen is open. Do not ref or unref it.

refsect2.para: Since 2.10

refsect2.title: gtk_recent_manager_get_for_screen ()
refsect2.para: Gets the recent manager object associated with screen; if this function has not previously been called for the given screen, a new recent manager object will be created and associated with the screen. Recent manager objects are fairly expensive to create, so using this function is usually a better choice than calling gtk_recent_manager_new() and setting the screen yourself; by using this function a single recent manager object will be shared between users.

listitem.simpara: a GdkScreen
A unique GtkRecentManager associated with the given screen. This recent manager is associated to the with the screen and can be used as long as the screen is open. Do not ref or unref it.

refsect2.para: Since 2.10

refsect2.title: gtk_recent_manager_set_screen ()
refsect2.para: Sets the screen for a recent manager; the screen is used to track the user's currently configured recently used documents storage.

listitem.simpara: a GtkRecentManager
a GdkScreen

refsect2.para: Since 2.10

refsect2.title: gtk_recent_manager_add_item ()
refsect2.para: Adds a new resource, pointed by uri, into the recently used resources list.
This function automatically retrieving some of the needed metadata and setting other metadata to common default values; it then feeds the data to gtk_recent_manager_add_full().
See gtk_recent_manager_add_full() if you want to explicitely define the metadata for the resource pointed by uri.

listitem.simpara: a GtkRecentManager
a valid URI
TRUE if the new item was successfully added to the recently used resources list

refsect2.para: Since 2.10

refsect2.title: gtk_recent_manager_add_full ()
refsect2.para: Adds a new resource, pointed by uri, into the recently used resources list, using the metadata specified inside the GtkRecentData structure passed in recent_data.
The passed URI will be used to identify this resource inside the list.

In order to register the new recently used resource, metadata about the resource must be passed as well as the URI; the metadata is stored in a GtkRecentData structure, which must contain the MIME type of the resource pointed by the URI; the name of the application that is registering the item, and a command line to be used when launching the item.

Optionally, a GtkRecentData structure might contain a UTF-8 string to be used when viewing the item instead of the last component of the URI; a short description of the item; whether the item should be considered private - that is, should be displayed only by the applications that have registered it.

listitem.simpara: a GtkRecentManager
a valid URI
metadata of the resource
TRUE if the new item was successfully added to the recently used resources list, FALSE otherwise.

refsect2.para: Since 2.10

refsect2.title: gtk_recent_manager_remove_item ()
refsect2.para: Removes a resource pointed by uri from the recently used resources list handled by a recent manager.

listitem.simpara: a GtkRecentManager
the URI of the item you wish to remove
return location for a GError, or NULL
TRUE if the item pointed by uri has been successfully removed by the recently used resources list, and FALSE otherwise.

refsect2.para: Since 2.10

refsect2.title: gtk_recent_manager_lookup_item ()
refsect2.para: Searches for a URI inside the recently used resources list, and returns a structure containing informations about the resource like its MIME type, or its display name.

listitem.simpara: a GtkRecentManager
a URI
a return location for a GError, or NULL
a GtkRecentInfo structure containing information about the resource pointed by uri, or NULL if the URI was not registered in the recently used resources list. Free with gtk_recent_info_unref().

refsect2.para: Since 2.10

refsect2.title: gtk_recent_manager_has_item ()
refsect2.para: Checks whether there is a recently used resource registered with uri inside the recent manager.

listitem.simpara: a GtkRecentManager
a URI
TRUE if the resource was found, FALSE otherwise.

refsect2.para: Since 2.10

refsect2.title: gtk_recent_manager_move_item ()
refsect2.programlisting: gboolean gtk_recent_manager_move_item (GtkRecentManager *manager, const gchar *uri, const gchar *new_uri, GError **error);
refsect2.para: Changes the location of a recently used resource from uri to new_uri.
Please note that this function will not affect the resource pointed by the URIs, but only the URI used in the recently used resources list.

listitem.simpara: a GtkRecentManager
the URI of a recently used resource
the new URI of the recently used resource, or NULL to remove the item pointed by uri in the list
a return location for a GError, or NULL
TRUE on success.

refsect2.para: Since 2.10

refsect2.title: gtk_recent_manager_get_limit ()
refsect2.para: Gets the maximum number of items that the gtk_recent_manager_get_items() function should return.

listitem.simpara: a GtkRecentManager
the number of items to return, or -1 for every item.

refsect2.para: Since 2.10

refsect2.title: gtk_recent_manager_set_limit ()
refsect2.para: Sets the maximum number of item that the gtk_recent_manager_get_items() function should return. If limit is set to -1, then return all the items.

listitem.simpara: a GtkRecentManager
the maximum number of items to return, or -1.

refsect2.para: Since 2.10

refsect2.title: gtk_recent_manager_get_items ()
refsect2.para: Gets the list of recently used resources.

listitem.simpara: a GtkRecentManager
a list of newly allocated GtkRecentInfo objects. Use gtk_recent_info_unref() on each item inside the list, and then free the list itself using g_list_free().

refsect2.para: Since 2.10

refsect2.title: gtk_recent_manager_purge_items ()
refsect2.para: Purges every item from the recently used resources list.

listitem.simpara: a GtkRecentManager
a return location for a GError, or NULL
the number of items that have been removed from the recently used resources list.

refsect2.para: Since 2.10

refsect2.title: gtk_recent_info_ref ()
refsect2.para: Increases the reference count of recent_info by one.

listitem.simpara: a GtkRecentInfo
the recent info object with its reference count increased by one.

refsect2.para: Since 2.10

refsect2.title: gtk_recent_info_unref ()
refsect2.para: Decreases the reference count of info by one. If the reference count reaches zero, info is deallocated, and the memory freed.

listitem.simpara: a GtkRecentInfo

refsect2.para: Since 2.10

refsect2.title: gtk_recent_info_get_uri ()
refsect2.para: Gets the URI of the resource.

listitem.simpara: a GtkRecentInfo
the URI of the resource. The returned string is owned by the recent manager, and should not be freed.

refsect2.para: Since 2.10

refsect2.title: gtk_recent_info_get_display_name ()
refsect2.para: Gets the name of the resource. If none has been defined, the basename of the resource is obtained.

listitem.simpara: a GtkRecentInfo
the display name of the resource. The returned string is owned by the recent manager, and should not be freed.

refsect2.para: Since 2.10

refsect2.title: gtk_recent_info_get_description ()
refsect2.para: Gets the (short) description of the resource.

listitem.simpara: a GtkRecentInfo
the description of the resource. The returned string is owned by the recent manager, and should not be freed.

refsect2.para: Since 2.10

refsect2.title: gtk_recent_info_get_mime_type ()
refsect2.para: Gets the MIME type of the resource.

listitem.simpara: a GtkRecentInfo
the MIME type of the resource. The returned string is owned by the recent manager, and should not be freed.

refsect2.para: Since 2.10

refsect2.title: gtk_recent_info_get_added ()
refsect2.para: Gets the timestamp (seconds from system's Epoch) when the resource was added to the recently used resources list.

listitem.simpara: a GtkRecentInfo
the number of seconds elapsed from system's Epoch when the resource was added to the list, or -1 on failure.

refsect2.para: Since 2.10

refsect2.title: gtk_recent_info_get_modified ()
refsect2.para: Gets the timestamp (seconds from system's Epoch) when the resource was last modified.

listitem.simpara: a GtkRecentInfo
the number of seconds elapsed from system's Epoch when the resource was last modified, or -1 on failure.

refsect2.para: Since 2.10

refsect2.title: gtk_recent_info_get_visited ()
refsect2.para: Gets the timestamp (seconds from system's Epoch) when the resource was last visited.

listitem.simpara: a GtkRecentInfo
the number of seconds elapsed from system's Epoch when the resource was last visited, or -1 on failure.

refsect2.para: Since 2.10

refsect2.title: gtk_recent_info_get_private_hint ()
refsect2.para: Gets the value of the "private" flag. Resources in the recently used list that have this flag set to TRUE should only be displayed by the applications that have registered them.

listitem.simpara: a GtkRecentInfo
TRUE if the private flag was found, FALSE otherwise.

refsect2.para: Since 2.10

refsect2.title: gtk_recent_info_get_application_info ()
refsect2.programlisting: gboolean gtk_recent_info_get_application_info (GtkRecentInfo *info, const gchar *app_name, gchar **app_exec, guint *count, time_t *time_);
refsect2.para: Gets the data regarding the application that has registered the resource pointed by info.
If the command line contains any escape characters defined inside the storage specification, they will be expanded.

listitem.simpara: a GtkRecentInfo
the name of the application that has registered this item
return location for the string containing the command line
return location for the number of times this item was registered
return location for the timestamp this item was last registered for this application
TRUE if an application with app_name has registered this resource inside the recently used list, or FALSE otherwise. You should free the returned command line using g_free().

refsect2.para: Since 2.10

refsect2.title: gtk_recent_info_get_applications ()
refsect2.para: Retrieves the list of applications that have registered this resource.

listitem.simpara: a GtkRecentInfo
return location for the length of the returned list, or NULL
a newly allocated NULL-terminated array of strings. Use g_strfreev() to free it.

refsect2.para: Since 2.10

refsect2.title: gtk_recent_info_last_application ()
refsect2.para: Gets the name of the last application that have registered the recently used resource represented by info.

listitem.simpara: a GtkRecentInfo
an application name. Use g_free() to free it.

refsect2.para: Since 2.10

refsect2.title: gtk_recent_info_get_groups ()
refsect2.para: Returns all groups registered for the recently used item info. The array of returned group names will be NULL terminated, so length might optionally be NULL.

listitem.simpara: a GtkRecentInfo
return location for the number of groups returned, or NULL
a newly allocated NULL terminated array of strings. Use g_strfreev() to free it.

refsect2.para: Since 2.10

refsect2.title: gtk_recent_info_has_group ()
refsect2.para: Checks whether group_name appears inside the groups registered for the recently used item info.

listitem.simpara: a GtkRecentInfo
name of a group
TRUE if the group was found.

refsect2.para: Since 2.10

refsect2.title: gtk_recent_info_has_application ()
refsect2.para: Checks whether an application registered this resource using app_name.

listitem.simpara: a GtkRecentInfo
a string containing an application name
TRUE if an application with name app_name was found, FALSE otherwise.

refsect2.para: Since 2.10

refsect2.title: gtk_recent_info_get_icon ()
refsect2.para: Retrieves the icon of size size associated to the resource MIME type.

listitem.simpara: a GtkRecentInfo
the size of the icon in pixels
a GdkPixbuf containing the icon, or NULL.

refsect2.para: Since 2.10

refsect2.title: gtk_recent_info_get_short_name ()
refsect2.para: Computes a valid UTF-8 string that can be used as the name of the item in a menu or list. For example, calling this function on an item that refers to "file:///foo/bar.txt" will yield "bar.txt".

listitem.simpara: an GtkRecentInfo
A newly-allocated string in UTF-8 encoding; free it with g_free().

refsect2.para: Since 2.10

refsect2.title: gtk_recent_info_get_uri_display ()
refsect2.para: Gets a displayable version of the resource's URI.

listitem.simpara: a GtkRecentInfo
a UTF-8 string containing the resource's URI or NULL

refsect2.para: Since 2.10

refsect2.title: gtk_recent_info_get_age ()
refsect2.para: Gets the number of days elapsed since the last update of the resource pointed by info.

listitem.simpara: a GtkRecentInfo
a positive integer containing the number of days elapsed since the time this resource was last modified.

refsect2.para: Since 2.10

refsect2.title: gtk_recent_info_is_local ()
refsect2.para: Checks whether the resource is local or not by looking at the scheme of its URI.

listitem.simpara: a GtkRecentInfo
TRUE if the resource is local.

refsect2.para: Since 2.10

refsect2.title: gtk_recent_info_exists ()
refsect2.para: Checks whether the resource pointed by info still exists. At the moment this check is done only on resources pointing to local files.

listitem.simpara: a GtkRecentInfo
TRUE if the resource exists

refsect2.para: Since 2.10

refsect2.title: gtk_recent_info_match ()
refsect2.para: Checks whether two GtkRecentInfo structures point to the same resource.

listitem.simpara: a GtkRecentInfo
a GtkRecentInfo
TRUE if both GtkRecentInfo structures point to se same resource, FALSE otherwise.

refsect2.para: Since 2.10

refsect2.title: The :filename property
refsect2.programlisting: filename gchararray : Read / Write / Construct Only
refsect2.para: The full path to the file to be used to store and read the recently used resources list
Default value: NULL
Since 2.10

refsect2.title: The :limit property
refsect2.para: The maximum number of items to be returned by the gtk_recent_manager_get_items() function.
Allowed values: >= -1
Default value: -1
Since 2.10

refsect2.title: The :size property
refsect2.para: The size of the recently used resources list.
Allowed values: >= -1
Default value: 0
Since 2.10

refsect2.title: The ::changed signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (GtkRecentManager *recent_manager, gpointer user_data) : Run First
refsect2.para: Emitted when the current recently used resources manager changes its contents.

listitem.simpara: the recent manager
user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.para: Since 2.10
